subject: Re: [junit] [Q] Using "golden files" with JUnit
msgSnippet: Read in two ByteArrayInputStreams, and test for equality. Test by bytes, not by String content... otherwise you might fall foul of character encoding issues,
messageBody:
Read in two ByteArrayInputStreams, and test for equality. Test by bytes,
not by String content... otherwise you might fall foul of character
encoding issues, and they're rarely pleasant.

--
Stephen Smith, MEng (Wales).
http://www.stephen-smith.co.uk/

xqcom wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I am trying to figure out how to use a "golden file"
> along with JUnit. The basic idea is to create a golden
> file. Then run a JUnit test that should ideally produce
> the same output file.
>
> I am trying to find out whether there is a library somewhere
> that provides an assertFile() method.
>
> Would appreciatte your help on this.
>
> Regagrds
>
> - SD
